required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Curriculum Evaluation of a Novel Health and Wellness Program Within New York City Schools
clinical_study.official_title: Curriculum Evaluation of a Novel Health and Wellness Program Within New York City Schools

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to compare the academic and psycho-social benefits of a yoga-informed health and wellness program (HWP) to a standard physical education program for middle and high school students within New York City (NYC) schools.

detailed_description.textblock: Approximately 100 students at a public New York City High School will be randomized at the level of class into either the experimental (yoga-informed health and wellness program) or control arm (physical education class). Students will receive two classes per week of approximately 45 minutes throughout the academic year. Data will be collected in September 2014 and February and May of 2015.

primary_outcome.description: GPA was calculated as the numeric average of course scores of all courses taken by the student weighted by credit load of each course using a standard process within NYC public schools.

secondary_outcome.description: A 57-item self-report questionnaire that was used as a measure of emotional regulation We examined two of the five constructs (24 of the 57 items) within the RSQ as these were most directly theoretically relevant to expected changes due to yoga practice: voluntary engagement and involuntary engagement. Higher values represent higher levels of negative stress responses. Values for the voluntary engagement subscale represent the mean value across 9 questions on the survey and values for the involuntary subscale represent the mean value across 15 questions on the survey. Values for each item range from 0-3, trherefore the total mean values reported as outcomes range from 0-3.

secondary_outcome.measure: Warwick Edinburgh Mental Well Being Scale
secondary_outcome.description: A 14 item self-report measure assessing subjective well-being (1-5 scale). Higher values represent more positive mental well being. The summary measure is a sum of the 14 questions (not a mean). Summary values therefore range from 14-70.

other_outcome.measure: Self Report Questionnaire (Child and Adolescent Mindfulness Measure)
other_outcome.description: A 10 item self-report measure assessing mindfulness skills (Scale 1-4). Items are reverse scored and summed (not mean). Higher scores mean more positive mindfulness skills. Min and maximum scores are 0-40.

other_outcome.measure: Student Self-Report Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function
other_outcome.description: An 80 item self-report questionnaire assessing executive function and self regulation. The BRIEF-SR measures 8 non-overlapping clinical scales that measure different aspects of executive functioning with the Inhibit, Shift, Emotional control and Monitor subscales combining to create a Behavioral Regulation Index (BRI) and the Working Memory, Plan/Organize, Organization of Materials and Task Completion combining to create a Meta Cognition Index. These two indices combine to create a Global Executive Composite (GEC). Only the GEC was used within this study for analysis. Raw scores were converted to T scores (using gender and age for population norms) wherein a score of 50 represents the mean and a difference of 10 from the mean indicates a difference of one standard deviation.

other_outcome.measure: Teacher Report Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function
other_outcome.description: Teacher reported 87 item questionnaire on students executive function and self regulation. The BRIEF for teachers measures 8 non-overlapping theoretically and empirically derived clinical scales that measure different aspects of executive functioning with the Inhibit, Shift, Emotional control and Monitor subscales combining to create a Behavioral Regulation Index (BRI) and the Working Memory, Plan/Organize, Organization of Materials and Task Completion combining to create a Meta Cognition Index. These two indices combine to create a Global Executive Composite (GEC). Only the GEC was used within this study for analysis Raw scores were converted to T scores (using gender and age for population norms) wherein a score of 50 represents the mean and a difference of 10 from the mean indicates a difference of one standard deviation.

intervention.description: The HWP will be comprised of physical postures, breathing exercises, a period of sitting in stillness (meditation) and relaxation provided two times per week, 45 minutes per session, for the entire school year (Sept. - June).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- â€¢ Male or female students attending NYC schools
Exclusion Criteria:
- Lack of permission to attend physical education class

measure.title: Grade Point Average Previous Academic Year
measure.description: GPA was calculated as the numeric average of course scores of all courses taken by the student weighted by credit load of each course using a standard process within NYC public schools

measure.title: Lunch Status
measure.description: Data was not available for some participants relative to lunch status, therefore totals for each group do not equal baseline values

measure.title: Cardiovascular Fitness (Pacer Test: Fitnessgram)
measure.description: The Pacer test is a test of aerobic fitness wherein participants are required to run back and forth on a level surface 20 meters in length. The allowed time to successfully complete each 20 meter run is gradually increased via an audible timer. The score represents the final number of runs successfully completed within the allowed time. Values range from 1-106 with higher values representing greater levels of aerobic fitness.

outcome.title: Academic Performance: Grade Point Averages
outcome.description: GPA was calculated as the numeric average of course scores of all courses taken by the student weighted by credit load of each course using a standard process within NYC public schools.
outcome.population: Intent to treat analysis. Data from all participants was available at baseline and at end of study.

group.title: Health and Wellness Program
group.description: Behavioral intervention Yoga-informed Health and Wellness Program: The HWP will be comprised of physical postures, breathing exercises, a period of sitting in stillness (meditation) and relaxation provided two times per week, 45 minutes per session, for the entire school year (Sept. - June).

group.title: Physical Education Class
group.description: Behavioral intervention Physical Education Class: Standard physical education

measure.title: Academic Performance: Grade Point Averages
measure.description: GPA was calculated as the numeric average of course scores of all courses taken by the student weighted by credit load of each course using a standard process within NYC public schools.
measure.population: Intent to treat analysis. Data from all participants was available at baseline and at end of study.

analysis.groups_desc: Model 1: An intent to treat analyses was performed determining effect of group assignment on academic performance while controlling for previous year GPA.

Model 2: As active participation between groups was significantly different a second intent to treat analysis was performed which added to Model 1 (controlling for previous year GPA) by controlling for active participation.

Model 3: Per Protocol Analysis: it was hypothesized that any benefit of yoga education would only accrue if the student was assigned to yoga classes and actively participated in the class. A third Model was fit with an interaction term for class assignment and class participation.

outcome.title: Response to Stress Questionnaire (RSQ)
outcome.description: A 57-item self-report questionnaire that was used as a measure of emotional regulation We examined two of the five constructs (24 of the 57 items) within the RSQ as these were most directly theoretically relevant to expected changes due to yoga practice: voluntary engagement and involuntary engagement. Higher values represent higher levels of negative stress responses. Values for the voluntary engagement subscale represent the mean value across 9 questions on the survey and values for the involuntary subscale represent the mean value across 15 questions on the survey. Values for each item range from 0-3, trherefore the total mean values reported as outcomes range from 0-3.
outcome.population: Missing data: 2 from experimental group, none from control group

outcome.title: Student Self-Report Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function
outcome.description: An 80 item self-report questionnaire assessing executive function and self regulation. The BRIEF-SR measures 8 non-overlapping clinical scales that measure different aspects of executive functioning with the Inhibit, Shift, Emotional control and Monitor subscales combining to create a Behavioral Regulation Index (BRI) and the Working Memory, Plan/Organize, Organization of Materials and Task Completion combining to create a Meta Cognition Index. These two indices combine to create a Global Executive Composite (GEC). Only the GEC was used within this study for analysis. Raw scores were converted to T scores (using gender and age for population norms) wherein a score of 50 represents the mean and a difference of 10 from the mean indicates a difference of one standard deviation.
outcome.population: 9 subjects missing from experimental group and 9 subjects missing from comparison group

These two indices combine to create a Global Executive Composite (GEC). reported_events.desc: Teachers were instructed to report to the PI any incident in which a student was injured during the intervention. Minor injuries not requiring a visit to the nurses station were not reported.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: This study had several limitations including the lack of blinding of tester and an excessive reliance on self-report. Analysis limited by an inability to test effects due to clustering. Novelty, Pygmalion, or motivational effect cannot be ruled out.
